gurmukhi: < siqgur pRswid ]
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the Grace of the divine preceptor

gurmukhi: 1 vsqU niRdys mMgl mnu`Kw dyh sPl ikvyN hY
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the Grace of the divine preceptor

gurmukhi: EAMkwir Akwru kir pauxu pwxI bYsMqr Dwry
transliteration: Aoankaari Akaaru Kari Paounu Paanee Baisantaru Dhaaray.
translation: Oankar transforming into forms created air, water and fire.

gurmukhi: Driq Akws ivCoiVaunu cMdu sUru duie joiq svwry
transliteration: Dharati Akaas Vichhorhianu Chandu Sooru Day Joti Savaaray.
translation: Then separating earth and sky He threw two flames of sun and moon in between them.

gurmukhi: KwxI cwir bMDwn kir lK caurwsIh jUin duAwry
transliteration: Khaanee Chaari Bandhaan Kari Lakh Chauraaseeh Jooni Duaaray.
translation: Further creating the four mines of life He created eighty four lacs of species and their animalcules.

gurmukhi: ieks ieks jUin ivic jIA jMqu Axgxq Apwry
transliteration: Ikas Ikas Jooni Vichi Jeea Jantu Anaganat Apaaray.
translation: In each species further are born myriads of creatures.

gurmukhi: mwxs jnmu dulMBu hY sPl jnmu gur srix auDwry
transliteration: Maanas Janamu Dulabhu Hai Saphal Janamu Gur Sarani Udhaaray.
translation: Among them all, the human birth is the rare one.  One should, in this very Birth, liberate himself by surrendering before the Guru.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbid ilv Bwie Bgiq gur igAwn vIcwry
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadi Liv Bhaai Bhagati Gur Giaan Veechaaray.
translation: One must go to holy congregation; the consciousness should be merged in the word of the Guru and cultivating only a loving devotion, one should undertake to follow the path shown by the Guru.

gurmukhi: praupkwrI gurU ipAwry ]1]
transliteration: Paraoupakaaree Guroo Piaaray ?1?
translation: The man by becoming altruist becomes beloved of the Guru.

gurmukhi: 2 inMmRqw
translation: Humility

gurmukhi: sBdUM nIvI Driq hY Awpu gvwie hoeI EfIxI
transliteration: Sabh Doon Neevee Dharati Hai Aapu Gavaai Hoee Aodeenee.
translation: The earth is the most humble which eschewing ego is firm and steady.

gurmukhi: DIrju Drmu sMqoKu diRVu pYrw hyiT rhY ilv lIxI
transliteration: Dheeraju Dharamu Santokhu Drirhu Pairaa Haytdi Rahai Liv Leenee.
translation: Deeply rooted in fortitude, dharma and contentment it remains tranquil under feet.

gurmukhi: swD jnw dy crx Cuih AwFIxI hoeI lwKIxI
transliteration: Saadh Janaan Day Charan Chhuhi Aaddheenee Hoee Laakheenee.
translation: Touching the holy feet of the saints, it earlier being worth half a penny now becomes worth lacs.

gurmukhi: AMmiRq bUMd suhwvxI Chbr Clk ryx hoie rIxI
transliteration: Anmrit Boond Suhaavanee Chhahabar Chhalak Raynu Hoi Reenee.
translation: In the rain of love the earth gets satiated with delight.

gurmukhi: imilAw mwxu inmwxIAY iprm ipAwlw pIie pqIxI
transliteration: Miliaa Maanu Nimaaneeai Piram Piaalaa Peei Pateenee.
translation: Only the humble get adorned with glory and the earth, quaffing the cup of the love of the Lord gets satiated.

gurmukhi: jo bIjY soeI luxY sB rs ks bhu rMg rMgIxI
transliteration: Jo Beejai Soee Lounai Sabh Ras Kas Bahu Rang Rangeenee.
translation: Amongst variegated flora, sweet and bitter tastes, and colours on earth, one reaps whatever one sows.

gurmukhi: gurmiK suK Plu hY mskIxI ]2]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Hai Masakeenee ?2?
translation: Gurmukhs (in their humility like the earth) get fruit of delight.

gurmukhi: 3 crnwN dw diRStwNq
translation: Example of feet

gurmukhi: mwxs dyh su Kyh hY iqsu ivic jIBY leI nkIbI
transliteration: Maanas Dayh Su Khayh Hai Tisu Vichi Jeebhai Laee Nakeebee.
translation: Human body is like ashes but in it the tongue is admirable (for its benefits).

gurmukhi: AKI dyKin rUp rMg rwg nwd kMn krin rkIbI
transliteration: Akhee Daykhani Roop Rang Raag Naad Kann Karani Rakeebee.
translation: The eyes behold forms and colours and the ears take care of the sounds- musical and otherwise.

gurmukhi: nik suvwsu invwsu hY pMjy dUq burI qrqIbI
transliteration: Naki Suvaasu Nivaasu Hai Panjay Doot Buree Tarateebee.
translation: Nose is the abode of smell and thus all these five couriers (of the body) remain indulged in these pleasures (and become futile).

gurmukhi: sBdUM nIvy crn hoie Awp gvwie nsIb nsIbI
transliteration: Sabh Doon Neevay Charan Hoi Aapu Gavaai Naseebu Naseebee.
translation: Among these all, the feet are placed at the lowest level and they repudiating ego are fortunate.

gurmukhi: haumY rogu imtwiedw siqgur pUrw krY qbIbI
transliteration: Haoumai Rogu Mitaaidaa Satigur Pooraa Karai Tabeebee.
translation: The true Guru by giving treatment removes the malady of ego.

gurmukhi: pYrI pY rhrwis kir gur isK suix gur isK mnIbI
transliteration: Pairee Pai Raharaasi Kari Gur Sikh Souni Gur Sikh Maneebee.
translation: The true disciples of the Guru touch the feet and bow and abide by the instructions of the Guru.

gurmukhi: murdw hoie murId grIbI ]3]
transliteration: Muradaa Hoi Mareedu Gareebee ?3?
translation: He who becomes humble and dead to all desires is the true disciple.

gurmukhi: 4 cIcI AMgulI Awid dw diRStwNq
translation: Example of the little finger

gurmukhi: lhuVI hoie cIcuMglI pYDI Cwip imlI vifAweI
transliteration: Lahurhee Hoi Cheechoungalee Paidhee Chhaapi Milee Vadiaaee.
translation: The smallest finger is respected and adorned by making it wear the ring.

gurmukhi: lhuVI Gnhr bUMd huie prgtu moqI isp smweI
transliteration: Lahurhee Ghanahar Boond Hui Paragatu Motee Sip Samaaee.
translation: The drop from the cloud is small but the same but getting into the mouth of shell becomes pearl.

gurmukhi: lhuVI bUtI kysrY mQY itkw soBw pweI
transliteration: Lahurhee Bootee Kaysarai Madai Tikaa Sobhaa Paaee.
translation: The plant of saffron (Messua ferria) is small one but the same adorns the forehead in the form of consecratory mark.

gurmukhi: lhuVI pwrs pQrI Ast Dwqu kMcn krvweI
transliteration: Lahurhee Paaras Padaree Asat Dhaatu Kanchanu Karavaaee.
translation: The  philosopher’s stone is small but transforms alloy of eighty metals into gold.

gurmukhi: ijau mix lhuVy sp isir dyKY luik luik lok lukweI
transliteration: Jiu Mani Lahurhay Sap Siri Daykhai Louki Louki Lok Loukaaee.
translation: In the head of small snake remains the jewel which people behold in wonder.

gurmukhi: jwix rswiexu pwirAhu rqI muil n jie mulweI
transliteration: Jaani Rasaainu Paariahu Reet Muli N Jaai Mulaaee.
translation: From mercury is prepared elixir which is invaluable.

gurmukhi: Awpu gvwie n Awp gxweI ]4]
transliteration: Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaee ?4?
translation: Those who eschew  ego never allow themselves to be noticed.

gurmukhi: 5 A`g Aqy jl qoN inMmRqw
translation: Humility from fire and water

gurmukhi: Ag qqI jlu sIAlw ikqu Avguix ikqu gux vIcwrw
transliteration: Agi Tatee Jalu Seearaa Kitu Avagouni Kitu Goun Veechaaraa.
translation: It is a matter worth pondering as to how fire is hot and water cold.

gurmukhi: AgI DUMAw Daulhr jlu inrml gur igAwn sucwrw
transliteration: Agee Dhooaa Dhaulaharu Jalu Niramal Gur Giaan Souchaaraa.
translation: The fire soiles the building by its smoke and water cleanses it. This fact requires the guidance of Guru.

gurmukhi: kul dIpku bYsMqrhu jl kul kvl vfy prvwrw
transliteration: Kul Deepaku Baisantarahu Jal Kul Kavalu Vaday Paravaaraa.
translation: In the family and dynasty of fire is lamp, and to water belongs a bigger family of lotus.

gurmukhi: dIpk hyq pqMg dw kvl Bvr prgtu pwhwrw
transliteration: Deepak Haytu Patang Daa Kaval Bhavar Paragatu Paahaaraa.
translation: This is well known all over the world that moth loves fire (and gets burnt) and black bee loves lotus (and rests in it).

gurmukhi: AgI lwt aucwt hY isru aucw kir krY kucwrw
transliteration: Agee Laat Ouchaat Hai Siru Ouchaa Kari Karai Kouchaaraa.
translation: The flame of fire goes up and like an egotist behaves viciously.

gurmukhi: isru nIvw nIvwxu vwsu pwxI AMdir praupkwrw
transliteration: Siru Neevaa Neevaani Vaasu Paanee Andari Paraoupakaaraa.
translation: Water goes towards low level and has qualities of altruism.

gurmukhi: inv clY so gurU ipAwrw ]5]
transliteration: Niv Chalai So Guroo Piaaraa ?5?
translation: The Guru loves him who remains humble by nature.

gurmukhi: 6 mjIT-ksuMBy qoN aupdyS
translation: Teaching from madder Rubia munjista and safflower-

gurmukhi: rMgu mjIT ksuMB dw kcw pkw ikqu vIcwry
transliteration: Rangu Majeetd Kasounbh Daa Kachaa Pakaa Kitu Veechaaray.
translation: Why madder is the fast colour and safflower temporary.

gurmukhi: DrqI auKix kFIAY mUl mjIT jVI jVqwry
transliteration: Dharatee Oukhani Kaddheeai Mool Majeetd Jarhee Jarhataaray.
translation: The roots of madder spread in earth, it is first brought out and put into the pit and is pounded with wooden pestles.

gurmukhi: auKl muhly kutIAY pIhix pIsY ckI Bwry
transliteration: Oukhal Muhalay Kouteeai Peehani Peesai Chakee Bhaaray.
translation: Then it is crushed into a heavy mill.

gurmukhi: shY Avtxu Aig dw hoie ipAwrI imlY ipAwry
transliteration: Sahai Avatanu Agi Daa Hoi Piaaree Milai Piaaray.
translation: It further suffers the pain of getting boiled and decorated in water and then only it adorns (with fast colour) the clothes of the beloved.

gurmukhi: pohlIAhu isru kiFkY Pulu ksuMB cluMB iKlwry
transliteration: Pohaleeahu Siru Kaddhi Kai Phulu Kasounbh Chalounbh Khilaaray.
translation: The safflower comes up from the upper portion of the thorny weed Carthamus tinctoria and yields its deep colour.

gurmukhi: Kt qursI dy rMgIAY kpt snyhu rhY idh cwry
transliteration: Khat Turasee Day Rangeeai Kapat Sanayhu Rahai Dih Chaaray.
translation: Adding tart in it, the clothes are dyed and they remain dyed only for a few days.

gurmukhi: nIvw ijxY aucyrw hwry ]6]
transliteration: Neevaa Jinai Ouchayraa Haaray ?6?
translation: The lowly born utimately wins and the so-called high up gets defeated.

gurmukhi: 7 kIVI-mkVI Awid
translation: Ant, spider etc.-

gurmukhi: kIVI inkVI clq kr BiRMgI no imil BiRMgI hovY
transliteration: Keerhee Nikarhee Chalit Kari Bhringee No Mili Bhringee Hovai.
translation: Small ant becomes bhringi ( a kind of buzzing bee) by keeping company with it.

gurmukhi: inkVI idsY mkVI sUqu muhhu kiF iPir sMgovY
transliteration: Nikarhee Disai Makarhee Sootu Muhahu Kaddhi Dhiri Sangovai.
translation: Apparently, the spider looks to be small but it brings out and  swallows (hundred metres of) yarn.

gurmukhi: inkVI miK vKwxIAY mwiKE imTw BwgTu hovY
transliteration: Nikarhee Makhi Vakhaaneeai Maakhiao Mitdaa Bhaagatdu Hovai.
translation: Honey-bee is small one but its sweet honey is sold by merchants.

gurmukhi: inkVw kIVw AwKIAY pt ptoly kir FMg FovY
transliteration: Nikarhaa Keerhaa Aakheeai Pat Patolay Kari Ddhang Ddhauvai.
translation: Silk worm is little one but the clothes made by its fibre are worn and offered on the occassions of marriage and other ceremonies.

gurmukhi: gutkw muh ivic pwiekY dys idsMqir jwie KVovY
transliteration: Goutakaa Muh Vichi Paai Kai Days Disantari Jaai Kharhovai.
translation: Yogis putting the small magic ball in their mouth become invisible and go in the far off places undetected.

gurmukhi: moqI mwxk hIirAw pwiqswhu lY hwru provY
transliteration: Motee Maanak Heeriaa Paatisaahu Lai Haaru Parovai.
translation: Strings of small pearls and gems are worn by kings and emperors.

gurmukhi: pwie smwiexu dhI iblovY ]7]
transliteration: Paai Samaainu Dahee Bilovai ?7?
translation: Further, the curd is made by mixing a small quantity of rennet into milk (and thus butter is obtained).

gurmukhi: 8 Gwh
translation: Grass

gurmukhi: lqwN hyiT lqwVIAY Gwhu n kFY swhu ivcwrw
transliteration: Lataan Haytdi Lataarheeai Ghaahu N Kaddhai Saahu Vichaaraa.
translation: Grass is trampled under feet yet the poor thing never complains.

gurmukhi: gorsu dy KVu KwiekY gwie grIbI praupkwrw
transliteration: Gorasu Day Kharhu Khaai Kai Gaai Gareebee Paraoupakaaraa.
translation: The cow while eating grass remains altruist and gives milk to the poor.

gurmukhi: duDhu dhI jmweIAY dhIAhu mKxu Cwih ipAwrw
transliteration: Dudhahu Dahee Jamaaeeai Daeeahu Makhanu Chhaahi Piaaraa.
translation: From milk is made curd and then from curd butter and delicious butter-milk etc are prepared.

gurmukhi: iGA qy hovin hom jg FMg suAwrQ cj Acwrw
transliteration: Ghia Tay Hovani Hom Jag Ddhang Suaarad Chaj Achaaraa.
translation: With that butter (ghee) homs, yajnas and other social and religious rituals are performed.

gurmukhi: Drm Daulu prgtu hoie DIrij vhY shY isir Bwrw
transliteration: Dharam Dhaulu Paragatu Hoi Dheeraji Vahai Sahai Siri Bhaaraa.
translation: Dharma in the form of mythological bull patiently bears and burden of the earth.

gurmukhi: ieku ieku jwau jxyidAwN chuckw ivic vg hjwrw
transliteration: Iku Iku Jaau Janaydiaan Chahu Chakaa Vichi Vag Hajaaraa.
translation: Each calf produces thousands of calves in all lands.

gurmukhi: qiRx AMdir vfw pwswrw ]8]
transliteration: Trin Andari Vadaa Paasaaraa ?8?
translation: One blade of grass has infinite extension i.e.the humility becomes base of the whole world.

gurmukhi: 9 iql
translation: sesame - Sesamum indicum

gurmukhi: lhuVw iqlu hoie jMimAw nIchu nIcu n Awpu gxwieAw
transliteration: Lahurhaa Tilu Hoi Janmiaa Neechahu Neechu N Aapu Ganaaiaa.
translation: Small sesame seeds sprouted and it remained lowly and got itself not mentioned anywhere.

gurmukhi: Pulw sMgiq visAw hoie inrgMDu sugMD suhwieAw
transliteration: Phulaa Sangati Vasiaa Hoi Niragandhu Sougandhu Suhaaiaa.
translation: When it came to the company of flowers, it earlier being devoid of fragrance now become fragrant.

gurmukhi: kolU pwie pIVwieAw hoie Pulylu Kylu vrqwieAw
transliteration: Koloo Paai Peerhaaiaa Hoi Phulaylu Khaylu Varataaiaa.
translation: When alongwith flowers it was crushed in crusher, it became perfume oil.

gurmukhi: piqqu pivqR cilqR kir piqswh isir Dir suKu pwieAw
transliteration: Patitu Pavitr Chalitr Kari Patisaah Siri Dhari Soukhu Paaiaa.
translation: God, the purifier of the impure ones, enacted such a wondrous feat that that fragrant oil gave  pleasure to the king when messaged on his head.

gurmukhi: dIvY pwie jlwieAw kul dIpku jig ibrdu sdwieAw
transliteration: Deevai Paai Jalaaiaa Kul Deepaku Jagi Biradu Sadaaiaa.
translation: When it was burnt in the lamp it came to be known as kuldipak, the lamp of the dynasty generally lit to complete the last rites of man.

gurmukhi: kjlu hoAw dIivAhu AKI AMdir jwie smwieAw
transliteration: Kajalu Hoaa Deeviahu Akhee Andari Jaai Samaaiaa.
translation: From lamp becoming collyrium it merged in the eyes.

gurmukhi: bwlw hoie n vfw khwieAw ]9]
transliteration: Baalaa Hoi N Vadaa Kahaaiaa ?9?
translation: It became great but never allowed itself to be called so.

gurmukhi: 10 vVyvwN
translation: Cotton seed

gurmukhi: hoie vVyvwN jg ivic bIjy qnu Kyh nwil rlwieAw
transliteration: Hoi Varhayvaan Jag Vichi Beejay Tanu Khayh Naali Ralaaiaa.
translation: The cotton seed got itself mixed with dust.

gurmukhi: bUtI hoie kpwh dI tINfy his his Awp iKVwieAw
transliteration: Bootee Hoi Kapaah Dee Teenday Hasi Hasi Aapu Khirhaaiaa.
translation: From that very seed the plant of cotton emerged on which the balls smiled unobstructed.

gurmukhi: duhu imil vylxu vyilAw lUM lUM kir kir quMbu quMbwieAw
transliteration: Duhu Mili Vaylanu Vayliaa Loo Loo Kari Kari Tounbu Tounbaaiaa.
translation: The cotton got ginned by the ginning machine and after carding.

gurmukhi: ipM\\ix ipM\\ aufwieAw kir kir goVI sUq kqwieAw
transliteration: Pinni Pin Udaaiaa Kari Kari Gorhee Soot Kataaiaa.
translation: Making rolls and spinning, the thread was made from it.

gurmukhi: qix vuix KuMib cVwiekY dy dy duKu DuAwie rMgwieAw
transliteration: Tani Vouni Khounbi Charhaai Kai Day Day Doukhu Dhuaai Rangaaiaa.
translation: Then through its warp and waft it was woven and made to suffer getting dyed in boiling cauldron.

gurmukhi: kYcI ktix kitAw sUeI Dwgy joiV sIvwieAw
transliteration: Kaichee Katani Katiaa Sooee Dhaagay Jorhi Seevaaiaa.
translation: The scissors cut it and it was stiched with the help of needle and thread.

gurmukhi: ljxu kjxu hoie kjwieAw ]10]
transliteration: Lajanu Kajanu Hoi Kajaaiaa ?10?
translation: Thus it became cloth, the means for the covering up of others nudity.

gurmukhi: 11 Anwrdwxw
translation: Seed of the sour pomergranate

gurmukhi: dwxw hoie Anwr dw hoie DUiV DUVI ivic DsY
transliteration: Daanaa Hoi Anaar Daa Hoi Dhoorhi Dhoorhee Vichi Dhasai.
translation: The seed of promegranate merges into dust by becoming dust.

gurmukhi: hoie ibrKu hrIAwvlw lwl gulwlw Pul ivgsY
transliteration: Hoi Birakhu Hareeaavalaa Laal Gulaalaa Phal Vigasai.
translation: The same becoming green is adorned by flowers of deep red colour.

gurmukhi: iekqu ibrK shs Pl Pul Pl iekdU iek srsY
transliteration: Ikatu Birakh Sahas Phal Phal Phal Ik Doo Ik Sarasai.
translation: On tree, thousands of fruits grow, each fruit being more delicious than another.

gurmukhi: iekdU dwxy lK hoie Pl Pl dy mn AMdr vsY
transliteration: Ik Doo Daanay Lakh Hoi Phal Phal Day Man Andari Vasai.
translation: In each fruit reside thousands of seeds produced by one seed.

gurmukhi: iqsu Pl qoit n AwveI gurmuiK suKu Plu AMmRiq rsY
transliteration: Tisu Phal Toti N Aavaee Guramoukhi Soukhu Phalu Anmritu Rasai.
translation: As there is no dearth of fruit on that tree so the gurmukh is never at loss to realize the delights of the fruits of nectar.

gurmukhi: ijau ijau lXin qoiV Pil iqau iqau iPir iPir PlIAY hsY
transliteration: Jiu Jiu Layani Torhi Phali Tiu Tiu Dhiri Dhir Phaleeai Hasai.
translation: With the plucking of the fruit the tree again and again, bursting into laughter bears more fruits.

gurmukhi: inv clxu gur mwrgu dsY ]11]
transliteration: Niv Chalanu Gur Maaragu Dasai ?11?
translation: Thus the great Guru teaches the way of humility.

gurmukhi: 12 Su`D mohr
translation: The pure coin

gurmukhi: ryix rswiex isJIAY ryqu hyqu kir kMcnu vsY
transliteration: Aani Rasaain Sijheeai Raytu Haytu Kari Kanchanu Vasai.
translation: The dust of sand in which remains gold mixed is kept in a chemical.

gurmukhi: Doie Doie kxu kFIAY rqI mwsw qolw hsY
transliteration: Aai Dhoi Kanu Kaddheeai Ratee Maasaa Tolaa Hasai.
translation: Then after washing the gold particles are taken out of it which weigh from miligrams to grams and more.

gurmukhi: pwie kuTwlI gwlIAY rYxI kir suinAwir ivgsY
transliteration: Paai Koutdaalee Gaaleeai Rainee Kari Souniaari Vigasai.
translation: Then put into the crucible it is melted and to the delight of the goldsmith, is converted into lumps.

gurmukhi: GiV GiV pqR pKwlIAin lUxI lwie jlwie rhsY
transliteration: Gharhi Gharhi Patr Pakhaaleeani Loonee Laai Jalaai Rahasai.
translation: He makes leaves out of it and using chemicals washes it happily.

gurmukhi: bwrh vMnI hoiekY lgY lvY ksautI ksY
transliteration: Baarah Vannee Hoi Kai Lagai Lavai Kasaoutee Kasai.
translation: Then transformed into pure gold it becomes nimble and worthy of the test by touchstone.

gurmukhi: tkswlY iskw pvY Gx Ahrix ivic Aclu srsY
transliteration: Takasaalai Sikaa Pavai Ghan Aharani Vichi Achalu Sarasai.
translation: Now in the mint, it is moulded into a coin and remains happy on the anvil even under the strokes of hammer.

gurmukhi: swlu suneIAw poqY psY ]12]
transliteration: Saalu Sounaeeaa Potai Pasai ?12?
translation: Then becoming pure muhar, a gold coin, it gets deposited into treasury i.e.the gold which was in the dust particles because of its humility, ultimately turns out to be a coin of the treasure house.

gurmukhi: 13 ^S^wS dwxw
translation: The poppy seed

gurmukhi: KsKs dwxw hoie kY Kwk AMdir hoie Kwk smwvY
transliteration: Khasakhas Daanaa Hoi Kai Khaak Andari Hoi Khaak Samaavai.
translation: Mixing with dust the poppy seed becomes one with dust.

gurmukhi: dosqu posq bUt hoie rMg ibrMgI Pul iKVwvY
transliteration: Dosatu Posatu Bootu Hoi Rang Birangee Phul Khirhaavai.
translation: Becoming lovely poppy plant it blossoms with variegated flowers.

gurmukhi: hofw hofI fofIAw iek dUM iek cVHwau cVHwvY
transliteration: Hodaa Hodee Dodeeaa Ik Doon Ik Charhhaau Charhhaavai.
translation: Its flower buds vie with one another to look beautiful.

gurmukhi: sUlI aupir Kylxw ipCoN dy isir CqR DrwvY
transliteration: Soolee Oupari Khaylanaa Pichhon Day Siri Chhatr Dharaavai.
translation: First that poppy suffers on a long thorn but afterwards becoming circular assumes the shape of canopy.

gurmukhi: cuKu cuKu hoie mlwiekY lohU pwxI rMig rMgwvY
transliteration: Choukhu Choukhu Hoi Malaai Kai Lohoo Paanee Rangi Rangaavai.
translation: Getting sliced it oozes its sap of the colour of blood.

gurmukhi: iprm ipAwlw mjlsI jog Bog sMjog bxwvY
transliteration: Piram Piaalaa Majalasee Jog Bhog Sanjog Banaavai.
translation: Then in the parties, becoming the cup of love, it becomes the cause of joining of bhog, enjoyment, with the yoga.

gurmukhi: AmlI hoie su mjls AwvY ]13]
transliteration: Amalee Hoi Su Majalas Aavai ?13?
translation: Its addicts come to parties to sip it.

gurmukhi: 14 kmwd
translation: Sugarcane

gurmukhi: rs BirAw rsu rKdw bolx Axbolx ABirTw
transliteration: Ras Bhariaa Rasu Rakhadaa Bolan Anoubolan Abhiritdaa.
translation: Full of juice (sugarcane) is tasty and whether it speaks or not, in both the conditions, it is sweet.

gurmukhi: suixAw AxsuixAw krY kry vIcwir ifTw AxifTw
transliteration: Souniaa Anasouniaa Karai Karay Veechaari Ditdaa Anaditdaa.
translation: It listens not to what is said and sees not what is visible, i.e. in the sugarcane field one neither can listen to other nor a person  is visible in it.

gurmukhi: AKI DUV AtweIAw AKI ivic AMgUr bihTw
transliteration: Akhee Dhoorhi Ataaeeaa Akhee Vichi Angooru Bahitdaa.
translation: When in the form of seed the nodes of sugarcane are put into the earth, they sprout up.

gurmukhi: iekdU bwhly bUt hoie isr qlvwieAw ieThu ieTw
transliteration: Ik Doo Baahalay Boot Hoi Sir Talavaaiaa Itdahu Itdaa.
translation: From one sugarcane grow many a plant, each lovely from top to bottom.

gurmukhi: duhu KuMFw ivic pIVIAY toty lwhy iequ guix imTw
transliteration: Duhu Khounddhaa Vichi Peerheeai Totay Laahay Itu Gouni Mitdaa.
translation: It is crushed between two cylinderical rollers because of its sweet juice.

gurmukhi: vIh iekIh vrqdw AvguixAwry pwp pixTw
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Varatadaa Avagouniaaray Paap Panitdaa.
translation: Worthy people use it on auspicious days whereas the wicked also use it (by preparing wine etc out of it) and get perished.

gurmukhi: mMnY gMnY vwNgu suiDTw ]14]
transliteration: Mannai Gannai Vaang Sudhitdaa ?14?
translation: Those who cultivated the nature of sugarcane i.e. do not  shed sweetness though in peril, are indeed steadfast persons.

gurmukhi: 15 sÍwNqI bUMd qy is`p
translation: The svati drop and the shell

gurmukhi: Gxhr bUMd suhwvxI nIvI hoie Agwshu AwvY
transliteration: Ghanahar Boond Suhaavanee Neevee Hoi Agaasahu Aavai.
translation: A lovely drop of cloud falls from the sky and mitigating its ego goes into  the mouth of a shell in sea.

gurmukhi: Awpu gvwie smuMdu vyiK ispY dy muh ivic smwvY
transliteration: Aapu Gavaai Samoundu Vaykhi Sipai Day Muhi Vichi Samaavai.
translation: The shell, at once, closing its mouth dives down and hides itself in the underworld.

gurmukhi: lYdo hI muih bUMd ispu cuMBI mwir pqwil lukwvY
transliteration: Laido Hee Muhi Boond Sipu Chounbhee Maari Pataali Loukaavai.
translation: The shell, at once, closing its mouth dives down and hides itself in the underworld.

gurmukhi: PiV kFY mrujIvVw pr kwrj no Awpu PVwvY
transliteration: Dharhi Kaddhai Marujeevarhaa Par Kaaraj No Aapu Dharhaavai.
translation: The diver catches hold of it and it  also allows itself to be caught for the sale of altruistic sense.

gurmukhi: prvis praupkwr no pr hiQ pQr dMd BnwvY
transliteration: Paravasi Paraoupakaar No Par Hadi Padar Dand Bhanaavai.
translation: Controlled by  the sense of benevolence it gets itself broken on stone.

gurmukhi: Buil ABuil Amulu dy moqI dwn n pCoqwvY
transliteration: Bhuli Abhuli Amulu Day Motee Daan N Pachhotaavai.
translation: Knowing well or  unknowingly it bestows a free gift and never repents.

gurmukhi: sPl jnmu koeI vruswvY ]15]
transliteration: Saphal Janamu Koee Varousaavai ?15?
translation: Any rare one gets  such a blest life.

gurmukhi: 16 hIrw kxI qoN is`K gurU dw myl
translation: Diamond-bit and Sikh of the Guru

gurmukhi: hIry hIrw byDIAY brmy kxI AxI hoie hIrY
transliteration: Heeray Heeraa Baydheeai Baramay Kanee Anee Hoi Heerai.
translation: With diamond-bit of drill the piece of diamond is cut gradually i.e. with the  diamond bit of the Word of the Guru the mind-diamond is pierced.

gurmukhi: Dwgw hoie proeIAY hIrY mwl rswl ghIrY
transliteration: Dhaagaa Hoi Paroeeai Heerai Maal Rasaal Gaheerai.
translation: With  the thread (of love) a beautiful string of diamonds is prepared.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq guru sbd ilv haumY mwir mrY mnu DIrY
transliteration: Saadhasangati Guru Sabad Liv Haoumai Maari Marai Manu Dheerai.
translation: In the holy  congregation, merging consciousness in the Word and eschewing ego, the  mind is tranquilized.

gurmukhi: mn ijix mnu dy ley mnu guix ivic gux gurmuiK srIrY
transliteration: Man Jini Manu Day Laay Man Gouni Vichi Goun Guramoukhi Sareerai.
translation: Conquering the mind, one should surrender it (before the Guru) and adopt the virtues of gurmukhs, the Guru oriented ones.

gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwku hoie kwmDynu sMqryxu n nIrY
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaaku Hoi Kaamadhaynu Sant Raynu N Neerai.
translation: He  ought to fall on the feet of saints because even the wish-granting cow  (Kamadhenu) is not equal to the dust of the feet of saints.

gurmukhi: islw AlUxI ctxI lK AMmiRq rs qrsn sIrY
transliteration: Silaa Aloonee Chatanee Lakh Anmrit Ras Tarasan Seerai.
translation: This act is  nothing but licking of the tasteless stone though myriad tastes of sweet  juices one strives for.

gurmukhi: ivrlw isK suxY gur pIrY ]16]
transliteration: Viralaa Sikh Sounai Gur Peerai ?16?
translation: Rare is the Sikh who listens to (and accepts) the  teachings of the Guru.

gurmukhi: 17 jIvn mukiq dI krnI
translation: The conduct of the liberated one

gurmukhi: gur isKI gur isK sux AMdir isAwxw bwhir Bolw
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Gur Sikh Souni Andari Siaanaa Baahari Bholaa.
translation: Listening to the teachings of the Guru, the Sikh becomes wise internally though apparently he looks a simpleton.

gurmukhi: sbd suriq swvDwn hoie ivxu gur sbd n suxeI bolw
transliteration: Sabadi Surati Saavadhaan Hoi Vinu Gur Sabadi N Sounaee Bolaa.
translation: He with full care keeps his  consciousness attuned to the Word and listens to nothing except the words  of Guru.

gurmukhi: siqgur drsnu dyKxw swDsMgiq ivxu AMnHw Kolw
transliteration: Satigur Darasanu Daykhanaa Saadhasangati Vinu Annhaa Kholaa.
translation: He beholds the true Guru and without the company of the saints  feels himself blind and deaf.

gurmukhi: vwihgurU guru sbdu lY iprm ipAwlw cuip cbolw
transliteration: Vaahaguroo Guru Sabadu Lai Piram Piaalaa Choupi Chabolaa.
translation: The Guru's word he receives is Vahiguru, the  wondrous Lord, and remains silently immersed in delight.

gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie crix Doie crxodk Jolw
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Charani Dhoi Charanodak Jholaa.
translation: He bows on the  feet and becoming (humble) like dust goes on quaffing the nectar of the feet  (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: crx kvl icqu Bvru kir Bvjl AMdir rhY inrolw
transliteration: Charan Kaval Chitu Bhavaru Kari Bhavajal Andari Rahai Nirolaa.
translation: He remains involved like black bee in the lotus feet (of the  Guru) and thus living in this world ocean remains unsmeared (by its water  and dust).

gurmukhi: jIvix mukiq scwvw colw ]17]
transliteration: Jeevani Moukati Sachaavaa Cholaa ?17?
translation: His is life of a liberated one during the life on earth i.e. he is a  jivanmukt'.

gurmukhi: 18 vwl dw diRStwq
translation: Example of hair

gurmukhi: isir ivic inky vwl hoie swD crx cvr kir FwlY
transliteration: Siri Vichi Nikai Vaal Hoi Saadhoo Charan Chavar Kari Ddhaalai.
translation: Preparing the whisk of even the hair of one's head (the gurmukh) one should  wave it on the feet of the saints i.e. he should be extremely humble.

gurmukhi: gursr qIrQ nwiekY AMJU Bir Bir pYr pKwlY
transliteration: Gur Sar Teerad Naai Kai Anjhoo Bhari Bhari Pairi Pakhaalai.
translation: Bathing  in the pilgrimage place, he should wash the feet of the Guru with tears of  love.

gurmukhi: kwlI hUM Dauly kry clxw jwix nIswxu smHwlY
transliteration: Kaalee Hoon Dhaulay Karay Chalanaa Jaani Neesaanu Samhaalai.
translation: From black, his hair may turn grey but then considering his time to  go (from this world) he should cherish in his heart the symbol (love) of the  Lord.

gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie pUrw siqguru ndir inhwlY
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Pooraa Satiguru Nadari Nihaalai.
translation: When one, falling at the Guru's feet, becomes dust himself, i.e. totally deletes ego from his mind, the true Guru also then blesses and obliges  him.

gurmukhi: kwg kumMqhuM prm hMsu aujl moqI Kwie KvwlY
transliteration: Kaag Koumantahoun Param Hansu Ujal Motee Khaai Khavaalai.
translation: He should become swan and leave black wisdom of crow and should  himself perform and get others perform pearl-like invaluable deeds.

gurmukhi: vwlhu inkI AwKIAY gur isKI suix gurisK pwlY
transliteration: Vaalahu Nikee Aakheeai Gur Sikhee Souni Gurasikh Paalai.
translation: The  teachings of the Guru are subtler even than the hair itself; the Sikh should  always follow them.

gurmukhi: gurisKu lMGY iprm ipAwlY ]18]
transliteration: Gurasikhu Laghai Piram Piaalai ?18?
translation: The Sikhs of the Guru go across the world-ocean by  virtue of their cup full of love.

gurmukhi: 19 gu`lr dw diRStwNq
translation: Example of a wild fig tree

gurmukhi: gulr AMdir Buxhxw gulr noN bHmMf vKwxY
transliteration: Gular Andari Bhounahanaa Gular Non Brahamandu Vakhaanai.
translation: Fig is the cosmos for the insect living in it.

gurmukhi: gulr lgix lK Pl iekdU lK AlK n jwxY
transliteration: Gular Lagani Lakh Phal Ik Doo Lakh Alakh N Jaanai.
translation: But on tree grow millions of  fruits which multiply further in numberless quantity.

gurmukhi: lK lK ibrK bgIicAhu lK bgIcy bwg vKwxY
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Birakh Bageechiahu Lakh Bageechay Baag Babaanai.
translation: Gardens are there of  myriad trees and likewise are millions of gardens in the world.

gurmukhi: lK bwg bHmMf ivic lK bHmMf lUA ivic AwxY
transliteration: Lakh Baag Brahamand Vichi Lakh Brahamand Looa Vichi Aanai.
translation: Millions of  universes are there in one small hair of God.

gurmukhi: imhir kry jy imhrvwnu gurmuiK swDsMgiq rMgu mwxY
transliteration: Mihari Karay Jay Miharavaanu Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Rangu Maanai.
translation: If that kind God showers His  grace, only then a gurmukh can enjoy the delight of the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwku hoie swihbu dy clY Ehu BwxY
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaaku Hoi Saahibu Day Chalai Aohu Bhaanai.
translation: Only then falling on the feet and becoming dust, the humble one can mould  himself according to the divine Will (hukam) of the Lord.

gurmukhi: haumY jwie q jwie is\\wxY ]19]
transliteration: Haoumai Jaai T Jaai Siaanai ?19?
translation: Only when ego is  erased, this fact is realized and identified.

gurmukhi: 20 dUj dy cMd QoN aupdyS
translation: Lesson from moon of the second phase

gurmukhi: duie idih cMdu Alopu hoie qIAY idh cVHdw hoie inkw
transliteration: Dui Dihi Chandu Alopu Hoi Teeai Dih Charhhadaa Hoi Nikaa.
translation: Remaining invisible for two days, third day the moon is beholden in a small  size.

gurmukhi: auiT auiT jgqu juhwrdw ggn mhysur msqik itkw
transliteration: Outdi Outdi Jagatu Juhaaradaa Gagan Mahaysur Masataki Tikaa.
translation: Supposed to adorn the forehead of Mahesa, people bow to it again  and again.

gurmukhi: solh klw sMGwrIAY sPl jnmu sohY kl iekw
transliteration: Solah Kalaa Sanghaareeai Saphalu Janamu Sohai Kali Ikaa.
translation: When it has attained all the sixteen phases i.e. on the full moon  night it begins diminishing and again reaches the position of the first day. People now bow before it.

gurmukhi: AMmiRq ikrix suhwvxI inJru JrY isMjY shiskw
transliteration: Anmrit Kirani Suhaavanee Nijharu Jharai Sinjai Sahasikaa.
translation: Nectar is sprinkled by its rays and it irrigates  all thirsty trees and fields.

gurmukhi: sIql swNiq sMqoKu dy shj sMjogI rqn Aimkw
transliteration: Seetalu Saanti Santokhu Day Sahaj Sajogee Ratan Amikaa.
translation: Peace, contentment and cool, these invaluable  jewels are bestowed by it.

gurmukhi: krY Anyrhu cwnxw for ckor iDAwnu Dir iCkw
transliteration: Karai Anayrahu Chaananaa Dor Chakor Dhiaanu Dhari Chhikaa.
translation: In darkness, it spreads light and provides the  thread of meditation to the chakor, the redlegged partridge.

gurmukhi: Awpu gvwie Amol mixkw ]20]
transliteration: Aapu Gavaai Amol Manikaa ?20?
translation: Only by erasing  its ego it becomes an invaluable jewel.

gurmukhi: 21 DRU Bgq dw diRStwNq
translation: Dhruv, the humble one

gurmukhi: hoie inmwxw Bgiq kir gurmuiK DRU hir drsnu pwieAw
transliteration: Hoi Nimaanaa Bhagati Kari Guramoukhi Dhr Hari Darasanu Paaiaa.
translation: By becoming humble only, Dhru could behold the Lord.

gurmukhi: Bgiq vClu hoie ByitAw mwxu inmwxy Awp idvwieAw
transliteration: Bhagati Vachhalu Hoi Bhaytiaa Maanu Nimaanay Aapi Divaaiaa.
translation: God, affectionate  to the devotees, also embraced him and egoless Dhruv attained the highest  glory.

gurmukhi: mwq lok ivic mukiq kir inhclu vwsu Agwis cVwieAw
transliteration: Maat Lok Vichi Moukati Kari Nihachalu Vaasu Agaasi Charhaaiaa.
translation: In this mortal world he was granted liberation and then a stable  place in the sky was given him.

gurmukhi: cMd sUrj qyiqs kroiV prdKxw cauPyir iPrwieAw
transliteration: Chand Sooraj Taytis Karorhi Paradakhanaa Chaudhayri Dhiraaiaa.
translation: Moon, sun and all the thirty three crores of angels circumambulate and revolve around him.

gurmukhi: vyd purwx vKwxdy prgtu kir prqwpu jxwieAw
transliteration: Vayd Puraan Vakhaanaday Paragatu Kari Parataapu Janaaiaa.
translation: His magnificence has  been clearly described in the Vedas and Puranas.

gurmukhi: Aibgiq giq Aiq Agm hY AkQ kQw vIcwru n AwieAw
transliteration: Abigati Gati Ati Agam Hai Akad Kadaa Veechaaru N Aaiaa.
translation: The story of that  unmanifest Lord is extremely mystical, indescribable and beyond all  thoughts.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu AlK lKwieAw ]21]4]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaaiaa ?21?4?
translation: Only gurmukhs can have a glimpse of Him.

gurmukhi: AMmiRq diRsit invws AMmiRq bcn Anhd sbd
transliteration: Anmrit Drisati Nivaasa , Anmrit Bachan Anahad Sabad ?
translation: n the divine glimpse of Guru Amar Das dwells the elixir of life. (On whomsoever he casts his look, he makes him immortal). His elixir-like words are like unstruck music.

gurmukhi: siqgur Amr pRgws imil AMmiRq AMmiRq Bey ]1]4]
transliteration: Satigur Amar Pragaasa , Mili Anmrit Anmrit Bhaay ?1?4?
translation: Resplendent True Guru Amar Das Ji became elixir-like after meeting Guru Angad Dev Ji. He now makes others calm and mortal.

gurmukhi: AMmiRq bcn Anhd sbd AMmiRq diRsit invws
transliteration: Anmrit Bachan Anahad Sabada , Anmrit Drisati Nivaas ?
translation: Meditating on unstruck melodious Divine Word, the sight and utterances of Guru Amar Das Ji, started showering elixir of life.

gurmukhi: imil AMmiRq AMmiRq Bey siqgur Amr pRgws ]2]4]
transliteration: Mili Anmrit Anmrit Bhaay , Satigur Amar Pragaas ?2?4?
translation: Meeting Guru Angad Dev Ji, elixir-like cool, tranquil and granter of emancipation, Satgur Amar Das too became the same.

gurmukhi: siqgur Amr pRgws qws crnwmRq pwvY
transliteration: Satigur Amar Pragaasa , Taas Charanaamrat Paavai ?
translation: Satgur Amar Das Ji who is light refulgent, whosoever partakes nectar-like wash of his feet,

gurmukhi: kwm nwm inihkwm prmpd shj smwvY
transliteration: Kaam Naam Nihikaama , Paramapad Sahaj Samaavai ?
translation: Becomes free from all desires is absorbed in high state of spirituality and equipoise.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK sMiD sugMD swD sMgiq inj Awsn
transliteration: Gurmukhi Sandhi Sougandha , Saadh Sangati Nij Aasan ?
translation: By the fragrance of Naam Simran of Guru Amar Das Ji, the Guru's obedient seeker finds stability in the company of holy men and Lord's devotees

gurmukhi: AMmiRq diRsit invws AMmiRq muK bcn pRgwsn ]3]4]
transliteration: Anmrit Drisati Nivaasa , Anmrit Moukh Bachan Pragaasan ?3?4?
translation: In the elixir-like vision of Guru Amar Das lies the nectar of life and his words provide elixir-like luminance of Naam of the Lord. (4)
